page.title: 04LAW AND ORDER IN WINTERTON 2
page.content: The policeman does most of his work by car because he has to stay in radio contact with headquarters. He has little time to walk. If he got a call from his walkie talkie when there had been an accident or something he would have to run all the way back to his car. In Winterton there is little truancy. Litter is a problem in some places. Nearby villages like Roxby are partolled by the Winterton police station as well. The policeman found Winterton people very friendly and ready to talk. He thought it was better than the large cities. Law and order is helped by parents who keep children under control. Police have club leaders help as well. Schools have few of the discipline problems of major towns.
